item.title: 调查称加拿大必须在大选前打击外国干预行为
item.description: 一项针对外国干预加拿大近期选举的调查呼吁情报机构和联邦政府在下一次全国投票前紧急改革应对中国、印度和其他国家行为体干预的方式。【原文：An inquiry into foreign interference in Canada’s recent elections is calling on intelligence agencies and the federal government to urgently reform how they respond to meddling by China, India and other state actors before the next national vote.】

item.title: 投票骚乱后，莫桑比克 2024 年收入目标偏离 10
item.description: 由于与选举有关的暴力事件阻碍了经济活动，莫桑比克去年的收入目标偏离了 10%以上。【原文：Mozambique missed its revenue target by more than 10% last year as election-related violence stunted economic activity.】

item.title: 富裕购物者保持谨慎态度，LVMH 销售低迷
item.description: 去年最后一个季度，LVMH 的销售额几乎没有增长，原因是节假日购物者对购买奢侈品仍持谨慎态度。【原文：LVMH sales barely rose in the final quarter of last year, as holiday shoppers remained cautious about splashing out on luxury goods.】

item.title: 曼哈顿包厘储蓄银行大楼将被拍卖
item.description: 包厘储蓄银行的前总部是曼哈顿下城的一个历史性地标，在陷入破产案多年后，它即将被拍卖。【原文：The former headquarters of Bowery Savings Bank, a historic landmark in lower Manhattan, is poised to hit the auction block after being ensnared for years in a bankruptcy case.】

item.title: 卖空者称美国无法证明他试图欺骗投资者
item.description: 做空者安德鲁-莱福特（Andrew Left）要求法官撤销对他在社交媒体上发布股票估值信息的欺诈指控，声称政府未能证明他有意欺骗任何人。【原文：Short seller Andrew Left asked a judge to throw out fraud charges over his social media posts about stock valuations, claiming the government failed to show that he intended to cheat anyone.】

item.title: 橡树庄园的霍华德-马克斯（Howard Marks）说，不要指望低利率时代会重现
item.description: 橡树资本集团（Oaktree Capital Group LLC）联合创始人霍华德-马克斯（Howard Marks）说，那些在宽松货币时代赚得盆满钵满的投资者不应指望同样的策略能在未来带来如此非凡的回报。【原文：Oaktree Capital Group LLC co-founder Howard Marks says investors who made a fortune in the era of easy money should not expect the same strategies to deliver such exceptional returns in the future.】

item.title: 分析显示，特朗普纪念币可能产生了至少 1100 万美元的费用
item.description: 根据加密货币风险建模公司 Gauntlet 的分析，唐纳德-特朗普的同名纪念币自其第二次就职典礼前推出以来，可能为与总统有关联的实体带来了至少 1140 万美元的费用。【原文：Donald Trump’s namesake memecoin has likely generated at least $11.4 million in fees for entities linked to the president since its launch just before his second inauguration, according to an analysis by the crypto risk modeling firm Gauntlet.】

item.title: 瑞士宝盛集团将裁员数百人，减少执行董事会人数
item.description: 瑞士宝盛集团（Julius Baer Group Ltd.）将宣布在未来两年内裁员数百人，新任首席执行官 Stefan Bollinger 将致力于降低这家瑞士财富管理公司的成本。【原文：Julius Baer Group Ltd. is set to announce hundreds of redundancies to take place over the next two years, as new Chief Executive Officer Stefan Bollinger focuses on reducing costs at the Swiss wealth manager.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德公司要约收购 Neoen 公司流通股
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理有限公司（Brookfield Asset Management Ltd.）提出购买 Neoen SA 的流通股，这是其计划以 61 亿欧元收购这家法国可再生能源开发商的最后一步。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management Ltd. offered to buy outstanding shares in Neoen SA, the final step in its planned €6.1 billion takeover of the French renewable energy developer.】

item.title: Venture Global、史密斯菲尔德首次公开募股失败威胁 2025 年的牛市行情
item.description: 备受瞩目的美国首次公开募股热潮一开始不是 "砰 "的一声，而是 "呜 "的一声。【原文：The much-anticipated boom in US initial public offerings has started off not with a bang but with a whimper.】

item.title: 西班牙将外资收购限制延长至 2026 年
item.description: 西班牙已批准扩大政府阻止外国投资者收购战略公司的权力。【原文：Spain has approved an extension of the powers that allow the government to block foreign investors from taking strategic companies over.】

item.title: 利比亚国家石油公司主席称东部港口已恢复石油装运
item.description: 利比亚国家石油公司董事长表示，利比亚东部两个重要港口因抗议活动而停止的石油装运已经恢复。【原文：Oil loadings from two key ports in eastern Libya, which had been halted by protesters, have resumed, the chairman of the nation’s state oil company said.】

item.title: 美联储资产负债表计划让华尔街对官员会议感到困惑
item.description: 在最近一个周末假期前夕发布的一份老生常谈的美国财政部调查报告中，隐藏着一个整个华尔街都想知道答案的问题：一旦美联储完成缩减危机时期的债券持有量，它的计划是什么？【原文：Buried in a rote US Treasury survey released on the eve of the latest holiday weekend was a question that all of Wall Street wants the answer to: What’s the Federal Reserve’s plan once it’s done drawing down its crisis-era bond holdings?】

item.title: 利纳马公司在关税威胁下投资加拿大电动汽车研究
item.description: 在加拿大汽车行业面临美国关税威胁之际，一家加拿大汽车零部件制造商将为安大略省工厂的一系列电动汽车技术项目拨款近 10 亿加元（约合 6.95 亿美元）。【原文：A Canadian auto parts maker will earmark nearly C$1 billion ($695 million) in a series of electric vehicle technology programs at plants in Ontario as the country’s automotive sector faces the threat of US tariffs.】

item.title: 对冲基金期权押注在科技股动荡中创下 2020 年以来最大涨幅
item.description: 在周一发生的市场大屠杀中，有一个出人意料的赢家：一种流行的期权策略，押注于平静。【原文：There was a surprising winner from the market carnage that unfolded on Monday: A popular options strategy that bets on calm.】

item.title: 尼日利亚酝酿新的能源补贴，150 亿美元的投资计划
item.description: 尼日利亚的目标是通过提高电价吸引投资者进入其陷入困境的电力行业，同时提供新的电力补贴，帮助家庭降低额外成本。【原文：Nigeria aims to attract investors into its struggling power sector by offering higher tariffs, while providing fresh electricity subsidies to help shield households from the extra cost.】

item.title: 保险商寻求出售的消息传出后，Brighthouse（兆光科技）股价飙升
item.description: 据《金融时报》报道，近八年前从大都会人寿保险公司（MetLife Inc.【原文：Brighthouse Financial Inc., spun off from MetLife Inc. almost eight years ago, is considering selling itself, the Financial Times Reported, and high-profile alternative asset managers are expected to bid for the life insurer and annuity provider.】

item.title: 网络威胁促使冰岛计划在国内处理支付事宜
item.description: 冰岛正在建立国内支付基础设施，以确保即使与世界其他地区隔绝，也能处理交易。【原文：Iceland is creating a domestic payments infrastructure to ensure it can process transactions even if the island is cut off from the rest of the world.】

item.title: 无人问津的市场动向
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 俄罗斯将向印度派遣受制裁的石油和油轮以测试新德里的神经
item.description:
被列入黑名单的油轮正在向印度运输太平洋和北极地区的原油

。【原文：

Blacklisted tankers are hauling Pacific and Arctic crude to India

】

item.title: 英国央行为养老基金推出新的紧急贷款机制
item.description: 英格兰银行开放了新的回购机制申请，该机制的目的是在市场出现严重压力时，向银行业以外的金融公司提供紧急现金。【原文：The Bank of England opened applications to its new repo facility, designed to provide emergency cash to financial firms beyond the banking sector at times of severe market stress.】

item.title: 受就业市场影响，美国消费者信心降至四个月低点
item.description: 由于对劳动力市场和整体经济前景的乐观程度下降，1 月份美国消费者信心指数意外降至四个月来的最低点。【原文：US consumer confidence unexpectedly fell in January to a four-month low on less optimism about the labor market and the outlook for the broader economy.】

item.title: X 选择 Visa 作为 "万物应用 "的首个数字钱包合作伙伴
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）与维萨公司（Visa Inc.【原文：Elon Musk struck a deal with Visa Inc., naming the payments company the first major partner on his mission to turn X into an “everything app.”】

item.title: 法国总统马克龙承诺为非洲电气化投资 10 亿欧元
item.description: 法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）表示，法国将向世界银行支持的一项旨在增加非洲电力供应的活动捐款 10 亿欧元（10.4 亿美元）。【原文：French President Emmanuel Macron said his country will contribute €1 billion euros ($1.04 billion) to a World Bank-backed drive to increase access to electricity in Africa.】

item.title: 科技界的 "清算日 "引发 2021 年以来最大规模的抄底热潮
item.description: 周一科技股的惩罚性大跌为在 11 万亿美元 ETF 领域徘徊的逢低买入者带来了机会。【原文：A punishing selloff in technology stocks on Monday spelled opportunity for dip-buyers prowling in the $11 trillion ETF arena.】

item.title: 销售疲软，宝马汽车利润率将低于预期
item.description: 宝马汽车公司表示，由于高档汽车销量下降，其 2024 年的汽车制造利润率将低于预期。【原文：BMW AG said its 2024 automaking profit margin will be at the lower end of guidance after falling sales of its premium cars.】

item.title: 瑞典 17 世纪军舰由钢铁制造商 Alleima 改造
item.description: 瑞典的瓦萨号是世界上保存最完好的 17 世纪沉船之一，它将接受 Alleima AB 公司定制的钢骨架，以确保其在未来几十年内的结构完整性。【原文：Sweden’s Vasa, among the world’s best preserved wrecks from the 17th century, will receive a custom-made steel skeleton from Alleima AB to ensure its structural integrity for the coming decades.】

item.title: 利比里亚预计新发现的矿产将带来 30 亿美元收入
item.description: 约瑟夫-博阿凯（Joseph Boakai）总统表示，在发现新的矿产之后，利比里亚有望吸引 30 亿美元的投资。【原文：Liberia expects to attract $3 billion in investment after the discovery of new minerals, President Joseph Boakai said.】

item.title: 格鲁吉亚大亨在伦敦法庭被前盟友指控 "破坏经济
item.description: 格鲁吉亚首富、前总理比季纳-伊万尼什维利（Bidzina Ivanishvili）正在与英国一位前商业盟友提出的腐败和敲诈指控进行抗争，这是他在全球各地打的一系列官司中的又一场。【原文：Bidzina Ivanishvili, Georgia’s richest man and one-time prime minister, is fighting allegations of corruption and extortion in a lawsuit brought by a former business ally in the UK, adding to a slew of legal battles around the globe he’s fighting.】

item.title: 美国房价增长加速，购房者勇往直前
item.description: 11 月份，美国房价涨势加快，因为即使在借贷成本增加的情况下，购房者仍在追逐房产。【原文：US home-price gains picked up pace in November as buyers remained on the hunt for properties even in the face of higher borrowing costs.】
